creator: S. Derbishire & G. Desbarats; Crown Lands Dept.
description:
1 map on 2 sheets, each sheet 77 X 142 cm. Sectioned and mounted on linen.
Compiled and drawn by Thomas Devine, Provincial land surveyor & draftsman, by order of the Hon[orabl]e Joseph Cauchon, Commissioner of Crown Lands.
"Maclear & Co. Lith., Toronto".
Geographical authorities used in compiling the map J. Arrowsmith; David Thompson; Sir Alexander Mackenzie et al.
Map extent: 45°N - 70°/85°W - 140°W.
Relief shown by hachures.
Map includes:
--Geological divisions (Crystalline, Silurian, Devonian and Coal/Lignite). Additional divisions appear to have been added at a later date (copper-bearing rocks, sandstones, Tertiary, Cretaceous etc.)
--mean temperature isotherms
--exploratory routes and important discoveries, physical descriptions
--faunal distribution limits
--forts: French Canadian forts at time of conquest; French forts prior to the cessation of Hudson's Bay to Great Britain; Hudson's Bay forts/posts
--international boundary with USA - 1818 and 1846
--Pacific railway line and profiles
--Boundary of Hudson's Bay after the Treaty of Utrecht in 1713
--British North America Indian population statistics
--hyetal data
Map originally drawn as map No. 8 of the Appendix to Report of the Commissioner of Crown Lands, Part II.
Map extent includes current provinces & territories of Manitoba, Saskatchewan, Alberta, British Columbia, Nunavut, Northwest Territories and Yukon Territories.
